skill.name: uspto-database
skill.description: Access USPTO APIs for patent/trademark searches, examination history (PEDS), assignments, citations, office actions, TSDR, for IP analysis and prior art searches.
skill.summary: Access USPTO APIs for patent/trademark searches, examination history (PEDS), assignments, citations,...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: The static analyzer flagged 513 issues, but evaluation shows these are almost entirely false positives. The code contains legitimate API clients for USPTO patent/trademark databases using standard HTTP requests and environment variables for API keys. No malicious code execution, credential exfiltration, or other security threats were found.

content.user_title: Search USPTO Patent and Trademark Databases
content.value_statement: Access comprehensive USPTO patent and trademark data for IP research and analysis. Query patents by keywords, inventors, or classifications and retrieve examination history, assignments, and prosecution data.
actual_capabilities: Search patents by keywords, inventors, assignees, or CPC classifications
Retrieve patent examination history and office actions via PEDS
Access trademark status and prosecution data through TSDR
Track patent/trademark assignments and ownership changes
Analyze patent citations and litigation records
limitations: Rate limits: 45 requests/minute for PatentSearch API
Some text endpoints (claims, descriptions) in beta

best_practices: Store API keys in environment variables, never hardcode them
Use specific CPC classifications for more targeted searches
Implement rate limiting and exponential backoff for API calls
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys in source code or configuration files
Making excessive concurrent requests without rate limiting
Ignoring pagination when retrieving large result sets

faq.question: How do I get a USPTO API key?
faq.answer: Register at https://account.uspto.gov/api-manager/ for USPTO APIs or https://patentsview.org/api-v01-information-page for PatentSearch API

faq.question: What's the difference between PEDS and PatentSearch?
faq.answer: PatentSearch finds patents by criteria. PEDS provides examination history and prosecution data for specific applications.

faq.question: Why am I getting rate limit errors?
faq.answer: PatentSearch API allows 45 requests/minute. Implement delays between requests and use exponential backoff when hitting limits.

faq.question: Can I search for international patents?
faq.answer: This skill uses USPTO APIs which cover US patents and trademarks. Use Espacenet or WIPO for international searches.

faq.question: How current is the patent data?
faq.answer: PatentSearch has data through June 30, 2025. PEDS covers applications from 1981 to present.

faq.question: What's the best way to search for similar patents?
faq.answer: Use CPC classifications combined with keywords. Start broad then narrow results with additional criteria.
